#HeavyRain..👉 Good evening Otago, today has been far from a summer’s day with heavy rain affecting southern and inland areas of the region causing road closures, surface flooding and rising rivers..☔️ It is very wet down south with the likes of Balclutha recording 189mm of rain over the last 72 hours and not long ago the Clutha District Council announced that the Owaka Highway was to be closed this evening due to the rising levels of the Clutha River, where it is expected to lift to 2200 cumecs between 6-11 pm tonight before climbing to 2500 cumecs by 4.00am tomorrow morning but the good thing is dry weather is expected from tomorrow onwards..😎 In other rainfall accumulated areas Kingston has seen a staggering 106mm of rainfall today, while Roxburgh has observed 72mm, Alexandra 69mm and Lawrence 59mm, we will be posting up everyone’s rainfall accumulations from today tomorrow night, so stay tuned for that..☔️ #OtagoWeatherUpdates Parts of the region are becoming isolated with heavy rain closing roads..⚠️ Here is the following road closures and warnings (Via NZTA) as of 9pm this evening..👀
